title: Dear Meddler, I have a few questions about Evelynn
body:
1. What archetype/class and subclass is she supposed to fall under?

2. Does she fulfill her thematic role well?

3. What is she supposed to do in gameplay and does she do it effectively?

4. What stat is she supposed to scale with, is it effective enough?

5. She seems to be underperforming, even amongst her mains. Is the balance team happy with her?

replies.body:
Evelynn's intended to be an assassin, with a heavy focus on flanking and range management within an engagement.  Like other assassins taking out a valuable target should be her primary goal. AP is intended to be her primary form of scaling. 

For a long time a more diver like playstyle, with pretty tanky builds, has been her most effectively way of being played though, which creates some thematic disconnect. Performance wise we see her as very middle of the pack when played by experienced Evelynn players and compared to other champions played by people familiar with them. Her average performance is a little on the weak side, brought down in part by newer players going for higher damage, squishier builds that tend to be less successful. Balance wise that means we feel she's in a reasonable, stable spot at present.

Long term Evelynn seems like a good choice for a full update someday, given that disconnect between champion thematics and play, plus the age of her model, visual effects etc. We won't get to her this year, we've got other champs already in the pipeline. Next year she seems like a strong, but not guaranteed, contender for a spot though. If we do assassins as the end of year class update it's likely she'd also get some adjustments then.

How is there a thematic disconnect here? Evelynn's costume and ability names seem associated with agony and torment which lends itself to a sustained damage pattern over burst, which would mean a diver rather than an assassin.

> [{quoted}](name=Quepha,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qH5oeXXW,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2016-04-27T18:28:10.181+0000)
>
> How is there a thematic disconnect here? Evelynn's costume and ability names seem associated with agony and torment which lends itself to a sustained damage pattern over burst, which would mean a diver rather than an assassin.

It's because you've got both selfish and selfless divers. If you want Eve to fit the agony and torment thing then she needs to be diving in like Xin Zhao, killing the squishies over the course of a couple of seconds. But Eve dives like Vi, to initiate on the backline and let her team kill everyone while she... tries not to die. Vi is actually a kind of iffy example because she has significantly more DPS than Eve does after the initial burst.

I think it's actually quite a clever assessment of Eve that she should be a diver rather than an assassin, but she needs to be a damage-oriented diver at the very least whereas right now she's leaning more towards the type of diving a tank does.

I'm a bit late to this discussion but I had an idea for Eve to be the diver that tries to stay and defeat her opponent at all costs.  How about give her a short passive that allows her to stay in it.  

eg: Passive added onto QWE or R: 

_Evelynn's torment enables her to strive through pain and agony. When an an attack would otherwise kill her, Evelynn gains Ataraxia, granting x% decreased damage from all sources for x seconds._

I'm thinking 90% decreased for 2 seconds.  Sort of like a {{item:3157}} active except not untargetable and she can still take damage & can be cc'd.  True damage would still bypass this passive for counterplay{{summoner:14}}

I don't agree with that exact idea, but I like the idea of a abilityset that likes getting hit. maybe that's the rule of assassins she breaks--she likes getting hit, and needs to carefully manage HOW hurt she gets hit to stay in the goldilocks zone for maximum defensive steroids/damage

Her thematic (lorewise) is supposed to be of an assassin who strikes quickly from the shadows, killing you and disappearing before anyone knows what's going on. As-is, bruiser Evelynn isn't quite fast enough at killing for that.

Arguably, neither is glass cannon Evelynn.

I don't think her passive can be balanced when she can deal real amounts of burst damage, and her passive is the most iconic part of her playstyle. If her playstyle, ability names, and appearance in game all thematically fit together while only her lore and champion tags don't fit, it seems easier and less disruptive to her players to just rewrite her outdated lore and update her tags.
But a lot of her players aren't *happy* with her current state as an assassin who's so bad at assassination that she is better built as a fighter.

I think it's more because her damage doesn't scale particularly well with damage items.  A fed glasscannon Eve has serious trouble killing even less-fed enemies if they are the tiniest bit tanky, while she herself will die extremely fast if she's made of paper.

That's because her passive range is rediculous. She has to have flash or ult just to go in, while most other assassins just point and click and are in. I'd love it if they changed her passive to be the range of her Q instead so that she could at least possibly go in more reliably.

The whole point of her passive is that it takes skill to stalk your opponents until an opening presents itself.
If it had a smaller range or some kind of gapcloser, then she's end up being like Rengar - completely do or die, blow up an enemy with no counterplay or don't have enough damage and just die.

There isn't any skill to it, its just waiting till someone does something stupid, or you burn long cooldowns. The reason she can't have 0 stealth range is because its perma stealth. 550 or 600, down from current 700 would be an interesting compromise.  At that range she might actually be able to engage somewhat reliably. Or maybe W no longer breaking Shadow walk.

This is all based on Meddler saying that she is intended to be an assassin though. I can't think of any other assassin that doesn't have a reliable way to close onto a target besides Eve.  If they change their mind and say she's supposed to be a bruiser, then its all out the window. Her W, R, and typically built Rylais are plenty for the Bruiser archetype.

Hey I feel very good at flanking with her so maybe I can offer some advice that could benefit you -

Obviously hang around on the sides now ideally you would want someone else to initiate - however, it's pretty frequent that I see an opportunity for a 4-5 man ult and I will take this chance to initiate (after spam pinging im going in!) This puts a massive slow on their entire team AND gives you a 1500 shield - which sets your team up for success.

Now, the more common route is when someone else initiates (either on their team or on yours) - I come from the side/behind and almost ALWAYS am able to get a 3 man ult (generally on the ADC/APC/support) but I aim my ult in the area that I will hit the MOST people, not always on my target (this is pretty important) 

**Finally, You have your W to close a gap, you have your blue smite to slow your target and close a gap, you have flash, you have your ultimate slow, AND you should have rylais which is a perma slow - this gives eve a TON of things to allow her to stick to her target** 

I generally try to blow up the apc or ADC (I normally can with a combo by mid-late game with a bruiser build). but if they kite back / live with the help of the support you will be tanky enough to run away after you use your combo - this will at the very least leave them with low enough health that they likely will be out of the team fight

On top of that, you nerfed her base damages significantly, made her Q costs much  more mana, and to finish her off you added a dumb mechanic to a skill that already refreshes on kill/assist.

Why is it that the best Evelynn players being middle of the pack is okay yet players who have literally NEVER played Ekko, or some other champions, can enjoy a higher winrate on their first game(s) ever with the champion than the average of hardcore Evelynn mains? How is there that disconnect where a champion is so blatantly overpowered that any random can pick him up and do better on average than a dedicated main of another champion? The average winrate of Evelynn players with 125+ games on her is still UNDER 50%. 

The problem is that her kit has been gutted so many times (all four of her active abilities in her kit have been gutted not only by SEVERE numerical nerfs, but by mechanical nerfs that change the way the abilities function) that she no longer functions as a champion herself, she is only an extension of the player's technical and macro skill. It takes someone with MASSIVELY more experience on her and with a MUCH higher skill level in the game to outplay (and still underperform in general) much worse players playing better champions. It doesn't help that items like Maw and Sterak's exist which are just a LOLNO purchase to AP Assassin Eve, who get's 1v1'd by anyone with either of those items (especially Maw) despite her being 5/0 and them being 0/5. 

The most frustrating part is that it feels like it takes SO MUCH EFFORT to achieve what other champions do by default. You have to be thousands and thousands of gold ahead just to output as much as other champions do and it seems like any time she is getting close to being even remotely good she gets nerfed. It feels like half of winning a game with Eve is not vs the enemy team but vs the balance team. You can be so incredibly skilled at her and it doesn't matter because of how badly she is treated in each patch. 

As someone once said, if everyone was tuned like how Eve is balanced around her passive, this game would be the most balanced game on the market. It's just so unfair that she is treated so badly while other champions can run rampant for months and months and have nothing happen to them (and in fact receive buffs much of the time) ~_~

She's built this way because you wanted to maintain the "spammy" playstyle us Evelynn players were accustomed to with Hate Spike, creating a DPS skill instead of a Burst skill. Ravage also increases attack speed, which encourages DPS over Burst again. The only time Eve really had any effective level of Burst was when DFG was still in the game, but that's been gone for quite some time now. It really shouldn't be a surprise that people build Eve for sustained damage and survivability when her kit encourages it.

Call her an assassin if you want, but her abilities do not support that path very well.

the fact that you cannot execute someone with her ult makes it really clunky to play as an assassin, but makes it much more fluid as a bruiser.

The problem with eve being a diver and not an assassin is that she has no way of getting out of an engagement. With a few tweaks she could go from tank to assassin. 

1.  Her w should put her passive off of CD and make it half the sight range too. This way when she gets seen she can enter stealth more easily. 

2. Give her a reason to want to flank and skirt the back lines before going in. Give her q a small stacking DoT (let's call in torment) that slows a target by 1% for each stackof torment. At 5 or 10 stacks it slows in an area. And begins to stack torment on other champs. She fills her target with pain and makes it that the rest of the team doesn't want to be near. Making assassination easier. 

3. Give her ult damage scaling from tornent stacks on a target. And a larger bonus shield for how many stacks of torment they had. 

The biggest problem with these changes is that they could also be played as a diver. To avoid the tank build, give the ap scaling a tweak. Or make it so that the stacks of torment will only stack on one person until you get to 5-10 stacks. Anyone else that gets hit will have the stacks start at one on them and removed from the original target. Also tgis is just something that I thought about for the past ten minutes so there are likely more problems. But just throwing in My two cents.

On paper, Eve's kit theme says Assassin/Skirmisher. Stealth has always been key to her identity, and the design and play space of "only True Sight and mid-range champion sight can see me" is integral to her motif.

However, the moment you're loaded into a game against actual humans with functioning brains and knowledge of the game's mechanics/meta, she falls flatter than a Jinx.

To be a (melee) assassin, one must be able to get, and possibly stick, to their target(s). In (almost) every case this involves a gapcloser, sometimes several, in order to reach their high value victim. It's considered normal for an Assassin to dive into the fight, drop a carry and die and be called successful. Eve can't do that.

Her sticking power is hoping they have no CC and only one Slow. Only a couple other (ACTUAL) Assassins lack a Garen-teed way to engage onto their target, and their kits give them different avenues of engagement.

________________

Twitch has proper True Sight Only Stealth to reach his desired position. Resetting on kill/assist gives him away to continue on or get out.

Jhin does not want to get close. His entire aesthetic is being THE SNIPER; Slowing traps and long range is how he finds targets.

Malzahar is only classified as an Assassin because of the excessive lockdown he can drop on a single target (as he violently throws up on them).

Teemo and Xerath are not Assassins, Rito. One is a Teemo, the other is just a dedicated-ly long range Mage.

Evelynn and those three are the only "assassins" who don't have a sure way of getting to their target. But Eve is the only one who isn't ranged. Convention says that she then must be really good once in melee: in damage output, survival, or other.  The sad part is, she's not.

____________________

She has DPS damage that requires a ludicrous amount of Offensive Stats to be a kill-threat in the short amount of time she'll have before her target gapcloses away. This flaw in her playstyle means a new (and better) build was found. Tank Eve. Tank build allows her to survive in melee while fulfilling the same general roll as a Sion or Rammus; excessive melee threat and disruption (though for her it's that even tanky, her damage is dangerous over a time) She's better built as a decoy than an assassin.
